intro: Chaenorhinum praetermissum, commonly known as the slender pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the family Scrophulariaceae, characterized by its slender stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators. Chaenorhinum praetermissum is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
